Hi,
does Heritrix send web forms forward to email addresses?

Namely, a local Sibelius-Academy keeps a web form where you can order
their students to perform at various happenings for a fee. You fill in
your info, press a submit-button and send the info to an email address
associated with the form.

The web form, although an empty one, was sent to their press manager.
She got the impression that we might be interested to have one of
their student bands here at our library.

She received the the form and got this information about sender
from = hyk-webcrawler@...  		
   [this is our contact address in order.xml]
sender's machine or proxy = nwa6a.lib.helsinki.fi        
   [machine where heritrix runs]
browser = mozilla/5.0 (compatible; heritrix/1.0.4
+http://www.lib.helsinki.fi/)
web form = 

This is actually not a problem since I haven't heard of anything
similar before. Just curious how it happened. If anybody is
interested, the form is at (3rd link on the left side)
http://www2.siba.fi/tapahtuu/tilauskonsertit.html
